thread.title: Chase-clinching scenarios at Talladega: What drivers need to advance
thread.title_full: Chase-clinching scenarios at Talladega: What drivers need to advance

author: customerservice@sportingnews.com (Joe Rodgers)
title: Chase-clinching scenarios at Talladega: What drivers need to advance
text:
Chase-clinching scenarios at Talladega: What drivers need to advance Sporting News 1 day ago customerservice@sportingnews.com (Joe Rodgers) © Ron T. Ennis, Fort Worth Star-Telegram, TNS/Getty Images Dale Earnhardt Jr. waits for Duck Commander 500 practice at Texas Motor Speedway in Fort Worth, Texas, on Friday, April 10, 2015. Once again it is elimination time and some of NASCAR's biggest names are in jeopardy of not moving on to the next stage of the Chase as the Sprint Cup series heads to Talladega Superspeedway.
AdChoices After Sunday's CampingWorld.com 500, four drivers will be eliminated from the Chase leaving eight to battle it out in the four remaining races in the Chase.
MORE: Jeff Gordon's career in photos | 2015 NASCAR Sprint Cup race winners
Only one driver has locked up a spot in the Eliminator Round — Joey Logano — thanks to his wins at Charlotte and Kansas.
Everyone else enters with a mathematical chance of missing the next round, which begins with the Nov. 1 race at Martinsville.
Here is a look at the Chase bubble entering Talladega:
7. Brad Keselowski, 3071, seven points above cutoff line
8. Martin Truex Jr., 3070, six points above cutoff line
The bottom four drivers will be eliminated from the Chase after Talladega. Here are the drivers in that group after the Kansas race:
9. Kyle Busch, 3064
10. Ryan Newman, 3062
11. Dale Earnhardt Jr., 3039
12. Matt Kenseth, 3035
Below are the top 11 drivers' (besides Logano) stats at Talladega and what each needs to do at the Alabama superspeedway to move on:
— Denny Hamlin needs to finish 14th with no laps led, 15th with at least one lap led or 16th and lead the most laps. The No. 11 driver has one win and seven top 10s in his career at 'Dega.
— Kurt Busch needs to finish eighth with no laps led, ninth with at least one lap led or 10th and lead the most laps. Among active drivers at Talladega, Kurt Busch has the second-most laps in the top 15 (2,537, 63.5 percent of total).
— Carl Edwards needs to finish seventh with no laps led, eighth with at least one lap led or ninth and lead the most laps. The 2.66-mile track has been tough for Edwards, who has a driver rating of just 66.4, which is the 32nd-best among active drivers.
— Kevin Harvick needs to finish third with no laps led or fourth with a lap led. The defending NASCAR champion has one win and 13 top 10s at Talladega in his career.
— Jeff Gordon and Keselowski need to finish second with no laps led, third with at least one lap led or fourth and lead the most laps. Gordon is tied for the lead among active drivers with six wins at Talladega while Keselowski has three wins.
— Martin Truex Jr. needs to finish second with no laps led or third with the most laps led. Truex has an average finish of 20.47 at 'Dega and a driver rating of 79.6 (12th-best).
— Kyle Busch, Newman, Earnhardt and Kenseth only control their own destinies with a victory.
Kyle Busch has struggled at Talladega with an average finish of 22.35, while Newman owns an average running position of 22.81.
Earnhardt has the best shot of winning to advance. He has a series-best driver rating of 92.8 to go along with six wins and 15 top 10s.
Kenseth is right behind Earnhardt with a driver rating of 89.2 (second-best) at Talladega and has a win and 10 top 10s in his career.
